Parchments, Please.Name: Introduction
Stanzas: So, you're the squirt that runs this place now?
Ehehehe, little young I'd say, but I suppose we'll see in time.
I'm <color=#CC18C9>Deidre Downton</color>- but you probably knew that. After all, my brewing prowess is unrivaled across all of Kastonia!
But don't get too starstruck dearie- so long as you keep my lips wet, you and I will be square!
By the way... I don't see your bartending certification hung up anywhere. That might prove to be an issue.
Don't get me wrong- I'll still be ordering something. Just figured you might want to rectify that quickly, ehehehe~

Deidre can Help.Name: Deidre can Help
Stanzas: Hmm? You're looking at me funny, dearie.
Ehehe! Then again, you always look funny.
You're concerned about the quake from earlier, hmm? Don't fret, why don't you let Auntie Deidre go figure it out?
I'll be back tomorrow with everything you need to know. Just hand me that little quest contract and I'll be on my way... after you give me a little something to drink for the trouble.

Conversation1.Name: Conversation1
Stanzas: Morning, dearie. Glad to see your bar starting to flourish with each passing day!
Of course, you have a long way to go before you reach my level of success, hmm?
Ehehehe... for future notice, the quicker you serve me a drink, the quicker I'll quit teasing you!

Day4College.Name: Day4College
Stanzas: I could've sworn that mousey little girl who just left bore a sigil of the College. You aren't getting yourself into trouble now, are you dearie?
I don't mean it to sound as if I'm speaking ill of the College. It's just that earning political favor is a balance- and you'll want to know who's at the other end of that scale, ehehehe...
But enough of that. I don't just come to flap my gums at you!

Day4Corporeal.Name: Day4Corporeal
Stanzas: Hmm? You want me to go on a quest? Again? Let me take a look.
Squirt, do I look like a diplomat? I'd probably bite their ears off! Ehehe~
But Ol' Auntie Deidre has a few tricks up her really baggy sleeves.
If you mix two ingredients of the same type, it'll give the guzzler a temporary perk.
It may not be what they order, but they'll feel the effects of the drink regardless.
For a quest requiring, ohhhh, socializing, add two <color=yellow>Skybursts</color> to the drink you give me.
Experiment with drink combinations to give different buffs.
Maybe you'll even find a patron's favorite drink!
Hehe, the little things you learn while brewing.

Day5CollegeRouteCorporeal.Name: Day5CollegeRouteCorporeal
Stanzas: Well look at you! Playing a little game of politics between mice and men, hmm?
Ehehehe, I’m only teasing dearie- don’t get your feathers in a ruffle!
...why is that journalist giving me a dirty look...?
You do what you think is right my dear, and just remember that you can always lean on auntie Deidre for help!
That is, so long as you remember our little agreement, hoo hoo...

Introduction.Name: Introduction
Stanzas: What's up, barkeep? By the way, I should probably introduce myself- you'll be seeing a lot of me!
Name's <color=#00FF7F>Artemis Cagosh</color>, but that's such a mouthful. You should just call me <color=#00FF7F>Artie</color>.
And don't worry- this thing ain't for bashin' skulls- well, not yours, at least!
It's mainly for gettin' rid of some of the more hefty chunks of rock down in the mines... heh, you know what I mean?
Er, sorry- didn't mean to talk your ear off.
What, you need me to pick something up from City Hall? Well sure, pal! A quick drink might be appreciated though.

AfterExplosion.Name: AfterExplosion
Stanzas: Man, you won't believe the day I had, barkeep...
Or, uh, maybe you will, dependin' on whether or not you felt that quake from here, heh.
Point is, the mines've collapsed, and I'm outta work for a bit.
Not really sure what to do in the meantime, but figure a drink might help me for a bit.

Artie Can Help.Name: Artie Can Help
Stanzas: Say, barkeep? Without a job, I don't have much to do.
If there's anything I can help you with, lemme know.
I ain't good at much, but I got a muscle or two I can leverage.
That is, so long as I'm hydrated, hah!

Conversation1.Name: Conversation1
Stanzas: Hey pal! Glad to see a friendly face, 'specially considerin' the recent events.
Everyone's losin' their heads over this Spire thing, and I gotta tell you, I'm not quite sure what to make of it.
I just wish there was a way to help more, y'know?
Anyways, pass me a drink- gotta hankerin' for one of your brews!

Day4Corporeal.Name: Day4Corporeal
Stanzas: People are asking what's goin' on, and, to be honest with ya, I am too.
People want answers, and they want 'em now. And it ain't like the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal're</color> being exactly transparent.
But if ya ask me Barkeep, I don't think anyone knows what's goin' on, and we oughta just help each other through all this.
I'm not the religious type or anything, but the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal're</color> a wise bunch- about as wise as the College is smart.
Ohh! Sorry. Didn't mean to go on so long!

Day5CollegeRouteCollege.Name: Day5CollegeRouteCollege
Stanzas: Hey pal! Beautiful day, isn't it?
I mean, I guess besides all the commotion goin' on in the center of town and whatnot. But hey, least the sun is out, hah!
Kind of sets me in the mood to get outdoors and DO something, y'know? I'm not gettin' as active ever since the mines collapsed!
But you pro'lly don’t wanna hear me moanin' all day, now do ya?

Day5CollegeRouteCorporeal.Name: Day5CollegeRouteCorporeal
Stanzas: Hey pal! Beautiful day, isn't it?
I mean, I guess besides all the commotion goin' on in the center of town and whatnot. But hey, least the sun is out, hah!
Kind of sets me in the mood to get outdoors and DO something, y'know? I'm not gettin' as active ever since the mines collapsed!
But you pro'lly don’t wanna hear me moanin' all day, now do ya?

Unemployment.Name: Unemployment
Stanzas: Sorry, Barkeep. I'm not really in a talking mood now.
Money's running shorter each day, and I'm not sure how much longer I can go.
You'll have to put this one on my tab.

Introduction.Name: Introduction
Stanzas: The name's <color=yellow>Horace R. Schuster</color> and, I assure you, the pleasure's all mine.
This is such a quaint little pub you have here- much more modest than the ritzy establishments I'd frequent in my youth!
Those places were so lifeless and ostentatious though, I much more greatly appreciate the modest decor you have here!
But I shan't waste any more of your precious time, and will get straight to the point.

AfterExplosion.Name: AfterExplosion
Stanzas: My goodness! Did you hear that?
'Twas enough to ruin an old man's already poor hearing.
Something that powerful must have impacted dozens of civilians. I'm fortunate to have been here, unaffected. And yet, I now have a responsibility to aid those who were.
Friend, I have always dreamed of becoming an adventurer, but my family business prevented me from doing so. Perhaps this is a chance to change all that.
If you hear of anything that suits my talents, please, allow me to help.
In the meantime, I'd love to partake in another of your finest brews.

Horace Can Help.Name: Horace Can Help
Stanzas: Greetings, friend! I've been told you could use a hand with relief efforts!
Well, fortunately for you, I have, not one, but two hands right here!
I may not have the strength of my youth, but I've found how to wield words over the years.
Come now! First a drink, and then I'll be on my way.

Conversation1.Name: Conversation1
Stanzas: Ah, there's my favorite bartender. Although it's not as if I frequent any other establishment, ho ho!
Have you been hearing about the protests up in the Borough? I imagine the Corporeal doesn't appreciate the civil unrest at their doorstep one bit!
It makes an old man wish there was more he could do in times like this, to help the next generation.
...it also tends to make me quite parched! Ho ho ho!

Day4Corporeal.Name: Day4Corporeal
Stanzas: Why, if it isn't my favorite bartender! Although it's not as if I frequent any other establishment, ha ha!
My, my, are you well? Your thoughts seem a journey and a half away!
Pah, the collapse of an old building, magical or not, ought not be cause for alarm.
The people are in good hands between the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal's</color> aid and the College's research on the matter.
I'm not one for gossip or debate, but I've heard that the College and <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> are bickering of late.
It seems the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color> are restricting particular magics from the College, who claim it impedes their research.
Nevertheless, those College youngesters are smart, and I'm certain they'll get all the information they need before long!

Day5CollegeRouteCollege.Name: Day5CollegeRouteCollege
Stanzas: Morning, my friend! With each passing day, the community in this bar seems to grow. Although that small girl in the back seems a bit young to be drinking, does she not...?
Bah, no matter! Surely you are an honorable barkeep, and wouldn't dare serve drinks to minors. I defer the judgement on the matter to you!
That being said, might you be willing to prepare something for your old pal Horace?

Day5CorporealRouteCorporeal.Name: Day5CorporealRouteCorporeal
Stanzas: Perhaps it would be finer if Artie was in better spirits, wouldn't you say?
Perhaps I could help the lad! And, I'll bring some 'spirits' with me to to lift theirs as well. Ha ha!

Day4Corporeal.Name: Day4Corporeal
Stanzas: So you're the altruistic bartender who helped the city guard and the Corporeal last night.
I assume you thought through your decision? The people aren't thrilled about it.
See, I'm an investigative journalist. It's my job to expose the things others don't want exposed.
I'd say your efforts held me back, but that might not be the case. Actually, you might have opened a door.
Speaking of, someone you might find interesting just walked in. I'll take my drink, and be on my way.

Day4College.Name: Day4College
Stanzas: By the gods, have you heard the news? Violent protests at the town center? Suspected government cover-ups?
This would make great headlines for tomorrow's paper! Perhaps a bit too sensational for my editor, however...
Sorry, kind of rude for me not to introduce myself. I'm Nell, an investigative journalist from the outer city.
From what I've heard, your establishment is a good place to come for a good story! Keep me in mind, should you ever hear anything.
Anyways, this gal could use a drink. All this excitement has me parched!

Day5CollegeRouteCollege.Name: Day5CollegeRouteCollege
Stanzas: What's up, barkeep? Looks to me as if you've got a full house on your hands today!
You wouldn't mind spilling your secrets, as to how you've gotten so popular, hmm? We could even make an interview out of it!
Hah! I'm just kidding- there's so much going on as of late, I'm up to my beak in article ideas!
Don't worry though- I still find you interesting. Why else would I keep coming back?

Day5CorporealRouteCorporeal.Name: Day5CorporealRouteCorporeal
Stanzas: My, my. We're the Corporeal's favorite now, aren't we?
It's no bother to me, but the College might start whining.
By the way, if they ever drop by, be sure to ask them about the Flux Experiment.
I'm certain you'll be interested, and yours truly would like to know a little more about it.
Until then, how about a drink and a lead?

Day5CorporealRouteCollege.Name: Day5CorporealRouteCollege
Stanzas: Well, well. It seems the College is excited about their new discovery, aren't they? I wonder how they got that information?
It's a good thing the Corporeal are understanding. I've been shown forgiveness for many, should I say intrusions? on their privacy.
Not that it'll change what I do.

Shaken, not Deterred.Name: Shaken, not Deterred
Stanzas: I don't mean to, er, interrupt- I imagine you're probably busy! And believe me, I know what it's like to be busy.

But, um... well, my name is <color=#D19F7E>Mavis</color>, and I represent the College of Magical Research and Recovery, and, er... I was kind of hoping I could speak to you, regarding the recent protests at City Hall?
It came to our attention (or more specifically, MY attention) that you were involved, to some degree, in helping out. Am I right?
U-um, ahem- I'm just going to make the safe assumption that I am. In which case, we at the College would like to thank you for your assistance!
We may not have been able to glean much information from the Corporeal, but they're certainly starting to feel the heat.
As you may (or may not) know, the Corporeal has been more or less in charge of maintaining the Spire, and kept their activities secretive for 'the good of humanity'.
We at the College find this to be hogwash, especially in light of recent events. Ever since the Spire fractured, they've been oddly quiet, holding private meetings at City Hall.
Now, er, bear in mind that what I'm about to ask of you isn't exactly... 'legal'. But hey, you seem like the kind of person that holds truth to a greater standard than law!
The City Council will be holding a series of meetings this week, presumably to be advised by the Corporeal on what to do about the Spire.
What I need YOU to do (please please please) is to have someone break- er, SNEAK into City Hall one evening, and listen in.
Then, just report back to me, and we'll take it from there!

Day5CollegeRouteCollege.Name: Day5CollegeRouteCollege
Stanzas: Hey! I haven't heard much in the way of what happened last night, so I'm hoping everything went well?
...o-oh, is that a report of what happened? Quick, hand it here!
Um... please pardon my hastiness. Time just happens to be of the essence.
...fantastic! I'm just going to go look over this in the back, I'll return once I've read through the entire thing.

Playing Politics.Name: Playing Politics
Stanzas: ...what, are you surprised at how fast I zipped through that? You should see the tomes I have to scroll through at work. *sigh*
But that's enough about my workload. What your, er, 'correspondent' stumbled upon appears to be in line with our fears.
That is to say: the spire is crumbling.
This is troubling, to say the least. Although I'm sure that goes without saying. For the past three and a half centuries, the Spire has granted us with magical prowess.
Its raw power has kept the creatures of the forests at bay, fostering an excellent environment for Kastonia to grow and thrive.
The Corporeal, of course, was founded as a means to protect the Spire from any harm. To 'stay the hand of man's greed' as they say.
But their unwarranted protection comes at a price- nobody except for representatives from the Corporeal are allowed anywhere near the Spire.
Information about our city's sentinel is scarce to come by, and I should know. I've scoured every library in the city!
And so it comes to this: we need someone to aid the college in our attempts for transparency. I need you to send someone to the Spire, and bring me back a chunk of the broken shard.
I'll leave your methods up to your discretion, but just know that your efforts will be forever appreciated by the College.
Let me know when this task is finished, barkeep. I'll be waiting!

A Lack of Info.Name: A Lack of Info
Stanzas: I'm <color=#D19F7E>Mavis</color>. I represent the <color=00FA9A>College of Magical Research and Recovery</color>.
We received your package yesterday, and our researchers were (well, actually I was) able to translate it.
If we're correct, and we normally are, then the Spire isn't its own source of magic; it somehow gets its magic from somewhere else.
The issue is that our readings of the Spire vary dramatically, so it's hard to gather any good data.
We could set up an experiment with a device we purchased from the Artifer's Alliance, but, well, we'd need to be near the Spire for it to work.
And, uh, the Corporeal wouldn't be happy to see us tinkering around there.
I even considered scheduling an information exchange between the College and Corporeal leaders, but that would take weeks to set up with our current relations.
Um, of course, you seem to know a few people that are in good standing with them.
Sorry for taking you away from your work. I'll get something to go, and let you get back to it.

PositiveIntroduction.Name: PositiveIntroduction
Stanzas: I greet you in the name of the <color=yellow>Pantheon</color> and their servants, the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal</color>.
I am <color=yellow>Gaius</color>, the <color=#64B5F6>Corporeal's</color> former flag-bearer and current liaison.
I have come for two reasons. First, to thank you for maintaining order yesterday. Second, to ask of you something else.
As you may know, the <color=yellow>Spire</color> is the source of magic for Kastonia.
Our order has warned against using it for millennia, since magic is reserved for the <color=yellow>Pantheon</color> alone.
Now that the <color=yellow>Spire</color> is unstable, the use of magic grows more threatening.
Please help us prevent the further use of magic, to preserve the <color=yellow>Spire</color>. We wish to trust you in this matter.
Once I empty that stein, I shall give to you a scroll containing a sacred text from the <color=yellow>Codex</color>.
Do with it what you will, but know that the stars are ever watchful.

A Matter of Magic.Name: A Matter of Magic
Stanzas: I have returned with the scroll, as promised.
I trust the divines will grant the wisdom you need.

Honor Before Glory.Name: Honor Before Glory
Stanzas: Barkeep. It was you who provided aid to the recent protests, was it not?
Please, don't try to deny it. I'm not here to scold you. In fact, quite the opposite, really.
My name is Gaius, and I am sworn to the Corporeal- Kastonia's venerable defender.
Whereas many of my peers see your act of rebellion as heresy, I see something else: a potential ally of impressive influence.
This belief is strengthened by the fact that you trusted your better judgement, and told us about the College's schemes.
Sure, you may have broken a law or two by slinking past our guards, but this does not discredit your sense of justice!
I’'l do what I can to ease the minds of my older colleagues in the matter, and perhaps, in return, you could provide some much-needed assistance?
I've heard whispers that the College plans to break into the Spire tonight- presumably to steal a fragment of the shard that broke off.
Unfortunately, we don't know where they'll strike... and bear in mind, the Spire has a breathtaking circumference. We can't guard it all by ourselves.
If you could hire one of your patrons to assist us, I can't promise that my superiors would be eternally grateful... but I would be.

Forbidden Actions.Name: Forbidden Actions
Stanzas: Greetings to you, Barkeep. We are fortunate you stand by us.
We were concerned your influence might disturb the path laid before our order, but it is clear we can trust you.
I will be honest with you, Barkeep. The people look to Kastonia's leadership for answers. The leaders, in turn, look to us.
The Spire's collapse is a mystery, one foretold in the ancient texts I gave you, but no reason or cure was ever prescribed.
I'm afraid that our last option requires gathering information from another faction, one we have fought for centuries, called the Eyes.
I personally wish to avoid them at all costs and have considered another option, one the Corporeal would not favor.
There is a relic that charges around magical entities.
I can stand watch over the Spire tonight, give the relic to your friend, and gather more information on the Spire.
I leave the choice to you, as you are the one with the resources to act.
...or maybe that confused look on your face means that you're still working on learning the ropes? Hah!

Now You Know Me.Name: Jim
Stanzas: Name's <color=orange>Jim</color>. I've been a patron of your parents since they opened this place!
...you still seem a little rattled. Tell you what, why don't I give you a helping hand! It's the least I can do for your parents' decades of service.
To start off, why don't you make me a <color=yellow>drink</color>? Been a while since I've had one of your parent's expert brews.
It shouldn't be all that hard. Each of the taps are <color=yellow>color-coded</color> after all, ho ho!

Jim Explains Rumors.Name: Jim Explains Rumors
Stanzas: Whoa there- looks like one of your patrons has given you a <color=yellow>quest</color>!
...what're you giving me that look for? You didn't think that serving drinks was your ONLY job as a bartender, right?
Whether wittingly or unwittingly, people tend to spill all sorts of <color=yellow>interesting problems</color> to whomever provides them alcohol.
It's up to you to help resolve these issues in the most efficient way- by passing them off to another patron and bribing them with drinks- ho ho!
This first one's easy- you just need someone to pick up your bartending certification, right?
Why not just ask the first person to come through the bar next? I'll take a seat in the back, just in case.

EndDay1.Name: Jim
Stanzas: Looks like you had a fairly successful first day!
I'm gonna head on out so you can close up shop, but don't worry- I'll be here bright and early in the morn'!

Day 2 Intro.Name: Jim
Stanzas: Mornin', kid! Y'know, I'm starting to get used to it being you behind that bar instead of your folks.
Despite your age, you actually make for a pretty good barkeep. Ho ho!
Now then, why don't you pour me a-

The Commotion.Name: Jim
Stanzas: ...holy smokes- kid, did you feel that?
I don't think it's just me... I only had a couple drinks before stopping by!
Felt almost like an <color=red>earthquake</color>, but a lot more violent and sudden. I wonder what's happened?
Whoa, whoa, hold on now- I see that look of eager curiosity in your eyes, but you've got a bar to run, right?
Why don't you have send another one of your patrons off? I know Deidre is a fairly perceptive lass, she may be best suited to the task.
And it'll give you the opportunity to keep doing your job! Speaking of which...

After Sending Deidre.Name: Jim
Stanzas: And now we wait! Ol' <color=purple>Deidre</color> may be a little... eccentric, but I can speak to her reliability.
Also, you may have realized this already, but your efforts to help out don't go unnoticed.
The more tasks you hand out to folks, the more chummy they'll tend to be with you.
And who knows? Maybe you'll end up <color=yellow>learning something new about them</color> in the process!
Anyways, I'm gonna go nurse this drink in the back for a while and let you tend the bar. Best of luck!

Your Civic Duty.Name: Your Civic Duty
Stanzas: So I take it you've heard the news by now, hmm? After all, it's not like you can't see it from here, ho ho!
Of course, I don't mean to make light of this situation. The <color=yellow>Spire</color> has been our benefactor of magical power for as long as anyone can remember.
After all, that's why Kastonia was built around that looming tower!
But I digress... there's not much that can be done about the <color=yellow>Spire</color> now, but the devastation caused by yesterday's event is still very present.
I know this isn't quite what you signed up for, kid, but maybe you could see about sending another patron off to provide aid? The city could use it.
Here, I'll hand this off to you while you think it over.

GDC Tutorial End.Name: GDC Tutorial End
Stanzas: Goodness! That sounded rather foreboding, didn't it? I wonder what they meant by that.
Unfortunately for you, the devs aren't willing to divulge that information quite yet. What a bunch of teases, ho ho!
However, I have good news. If you're interested in keeping up with this game's development cycle, you can follow the devs on Twitter!
Check them out at <color=yellow>@ArmsAndAle</color>, and give them a follow! I'm sure they'd appreciate it.
Well, alright kid. That's about all I've got for now. Hopefully I'll be seeing you soon.
Watch out for the release of <color=yellow>'A Tale of Arms and Ale'</color> this coming May!
